content.title: Iliac Artery Endofibrosis
content.description: Non-atherosclerotic stenosis of external iliac artery in endurance athletes

key_concepts.details: Competitive cyclists, triathletes, other endurance athletes; typically 30-50 years
Subintimal fibrosis causing stenosis; not atherosclerosis
Leg weakness/pain at high-intensity exercise; normal resting ABI
Surgical endarterectomy or release of vascular constraint; endovascular generally avoided

content.clinical_significance: High-level athletes with exercise-limiting leg symptoms need specific evaluation

primary_sources: Bender MH et al. Med Sci Sports Exerc 2004
